page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: {Cheshire,}a leading dairy county, is now seeing many changes. Large Friesian herds are interspersed with increasing flocks of sheep. The changes comply with supply and demand and meet E.E.C. regulations. There is too much milk produced so farmers have become very specialised or turned to mixed farming methods. {The Orchards,} a very successfuly farm, has been voted Dairy Farm of the Year. Grassland is widespread with potatoes being produced to meet increasing human demand. An average of 3 workers per farm shows man's dependence on modern machinery, the most valued being the Herringbone Milking Parlour and tractor. The average farm surveyed was 146 acres and the age, 135 years. A recent trend shows farms being sold and the land divided into bigger farms or for development.
